channel.title: My school IT guy thinks I'm a hacker?
channel.description: The IT guy for my school has command prompt disabled so I made a batch file and made it run ipconfig /all He disabled my account. I went to talk to him about it and he's like what are you trying to do with my DNS servers? And I told him I was just seeing if I could even get to ipconfig since cmd was disabled. He doesn't believe me. He said "Do you think I'm stupid? You're account is being deleted." So for the next 4 years, I'm not allowed to log on to the computers at school. How do I convince him to give me my account back?

item.title: My school IT guy thinks I'm a hacker?
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

I see your point, and sorry for being an asshole, though I tend to be one at times.

Read full topic
item.source: My school IT guy thinks I'm a hacker?

item.title: My school IT guy thinks I'm a hacker?
item.dc:creator: @mark033 mark033
item.description:
@mark033 wrote:

In no context is saying “I have the same access [but with more access]” grammatically correct; it definitely doesn’t make sense. You need a qualifying adverb or the use a different noun (which doesn’t work quite as well I guess). It’s not like I really care anyway, sorry for trolling.

Read full topic
item.source: My school IT guy thinks I'm a hacker?

item.title: My school IT guy thinks I'm a hacker?
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“mark033, post:41, topic:388913”]Well I’m not really a troll, I was just pointing out that your sentence didn’t make sense.

There’s no need to be so mean :([/quote]It made sense, I said I have those rights, then I realized that I had more rights then that so I added that little bracket snippet.

Read full topic

item.source: My school IT guy thinks I'm a hacker?

item.title: My school IT guy thinks I'm a hacker?
item.dc:creator: @Blood-Killers Blood-Killers
item.description:
@Blood-Killers wrote:

[quote=“Uncalled, post:32, topic:388913”]Good for you, I got my IP address blocked from the schools website because I performed a SQL Injection and the IT guy talked to me and said, “I don’t want to see that kind of crap again.” So I told him,
“You obviously don’t know how a SQL Injection works, I can un IP block myself and be back in the system, I don’t need an IP address to do it, also it’s easy to change your IP address.”
“Oh.” He said, was a pretty funny conversation.[/quote]

Then clearly he will know that it was you if it ever happens. Then again there is no proof so no conviction.

Read full topic

item.source: My school IT guy thinks I'm a hacker?

item.title: My school IT guy thinks I'm a hacker?
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

Good for you, I got my IP address blocked from the schools website because I performed a SQL Injection and the IT guy talked to me and said, “I don’t want to see that kind of crap again.” So I told him,
“You obviously don’t know how a SQL Injection works, I can un IP block myself and be back in the system, I don’t need an IP address to do it, also it’s easy to change your IP address.”
“Oh.” He said, was a pretty funny conversation.

Read full topic

item.title: My school IT guy thinks I'm a hacker?
item.dc:creator: @i_code_rsps i code rsps
item.description:
@i_code_rsps wrote:

[quote=“ytuio9, post:26, topic:388913”][quote author=Saphire` link=topic=484731.msg3564585#msg3564585 date=1302550459]

Just be like,

I’ll fuck the school’s internet up, if you disable me…

YES!

How could you do that? You could only ping data to the server in order for it to be crashed for a few minutes.
If it was an Intranet then you could take it down.

[/quote]
Well obviously since he can use cmd he can hack the school![/quote]

what’s wrong with cmd based interfaces? Seriously if IT staff at schools half knew what they were doing life would be a lot better. Tell him that you’re considering a job in networking and want to know more about how that type of stuff works, so you wanted to see what the school’s network was set up like.
